user.title: Heating Analytics Setup
user.description: Welcome to Heating Analytics! ðŸŽ¨ Let's get your home's thermal model set up. You can use specific sensors for precision, or simply use your weather provider to get started.

data_description.name: The name for this integration instance.
data_description.weather_entity: The primary weather integration used for forecasts.
data_description.wind_unit: The unit of measurement for wind speed settings below.
data_description.outdoor_temp_source: Choose whether to use a dedicated sensor or the weather provider for current temperature.
data_description.outdoor_temp_sensor: The sensor providing outdoor temperature data.
data_description.wind_source: Choose whether to use a dedicated sensor or the weather provider for wind speed.
data_description.wind_speed_sensor: The sensor providing wind speed data.
data_description.wind_gust_source: Choose whether to use a dedicated sensor or the weather provider for wind gusts.
data_description.wind_gust_sensor: The sensor providing wind gust data.
data_description.wind_gust_factor: Controls the impact of wind gusts on heat loss. 0.0 ignores gusts; 1.0 treats them fully. **Tip:** Older, drafty houses often need 0.5+.
data_description.balance_point: The temperature where your home starts needing heat. Typically 15Â°C for well-insulated modern homes, up to 18Â°C for older buildings.
data_description.thermal_inertia: Adjusts how quickly the model reacts to outside temperature changes. Use 'Fast' for lightweight structures, 'Slow' for heavy thermal mass.
data_description.learning_rate: Controls how fast the model learns. Keep low (0.5-1.0%) for stability, or increase (2.0%+) to adapt faster to recent renovations or changes.
data_description.wind_threshold: Wind speed above which the 'High Wind' model is used.
data_description.extreme_wind_threshold: Wind speed above which the 'Extreme Wind' model is used.
data_description.solar_enabled: Enable solar gain calculations to account for sun heating your home.
data_description.solar_azimuth: The direction your main windows face (0Â°=North, 90Â°=East, 180Â°=South, 270Â°=West).
data_description.aux_affected_entities: Select which heating units are helped by auxiliary heat (e.g. fireplace). Defaults to all if empty.
data_description.secondary_weather_entity: Optional secondary provider for long-range forecasts (Shadow Forecasting).
data_description.forecast_crossover_day: Days to use the Primary weather source before switching to Secondary (long-term). Example: Set to 3 to use Primary for days 1-3.
data_description.max_energy_delta: Ignore hourly readings above this value (kWh) to prevent sensor glitches from ruining your stats.
data_description.has_ac_units: Enable this if you use your system for cooling (AC) to see cooling modes.
data_description.energy_sensors: Select all sensors measuring energy consumption (kWh) for your heating devices.
data_description.csv_auto_logging: Automatically write detailed hourly logs to CSV files for external analysis.
data_description.csv_hourly_path: File path for the hourly CSV log.
data_description.csv_daily_path: File path for the daily CSV log.
data_description.enable_lifetime_tracking: Keep a cumulative history of energy usage for all time. (Increases database size).

reconfigure.title: Settings
reconfigure.description: Adjust your system settings. **Note:** Changing the Learning Rate or adding new sensors may temporarily fluctuate your prediction accuracy while the model adapts.
